content.description:
The Daily Routine of Pliny’s Friend Spurinna

Ubi hora balinei balneum, -i, n.: bathnuntiata est (est autem hieme nonanonus, -a, -um, adj.: ninth), in
sole ambulat nudusnudus, -a, -um, adj.: naked. Deinde movetur pilapila, -ae, f.: ball vehementer et
diu; nam hoc exercitationisexercitatio, -onis, f.: exercise genere pugnat cum senectutesenectus, -tutis, f.: old age.
content.question: According to lines 2-3 (Deinde...senectute), why did Spurinna exercise so diligently?

choices.label: To be more exposed to sunlight
To slow down the aging process
To compete with his elderly friends

content.answer: To slow down the aging process
